content: tentacle variations at the end of the directions** 15 slip_stitch into the base of the first tentacle end leave a tail for sewing body closed 16 place eyes between row 8 and 9 or 9 and 10 3-5 sts apart closer spacing and higher eyes give a cuter octopus wider spacing and lower eyes gives a more realistic octopus yellow cat eyes are the most realistic see the blue octopus in the cover photo and at the end but my 2 year old was calling the design shots this time and wanted red eyes for his red octopus he likes red 17 stuff the body and put in a rattle if desired but don t stuff the neck area if you stuff firmly the head will be upright and cuter if you stuff more loosely you can tilt the head down to the back for a more realistic look 18 using the yarn needle run the tail of yarn to the center underside of the octopus left photo below 19 using the back loops the little ring indicated by the arrow in the center photo below sew the opening closed 20 sew in the end and enjoy your octopus tentacle variations it looks nice if the octopus s tentacles have some variety to them here are three basic ways to change the curliness of the tentacles i used a combination of these styles for my red octopus see photo below mostly straight chain 10 turn starting in 2nd chain from the hook single_crochet 9 back along the chain a little curlier chain 9 turn starting in 2nd chain from the hook single_crochet 2sc four times back along the chain curliest ch8 turn starting in 2nd chain from the hook single_crochet 2sc in the remaining 6 chains the number of chains varies to make the tentacles appear the same length you can also do any combination of single_crochet 2sc and maybe even 3sc when you are working back along the chain get creative
